title: This has boggled my mind for so long
body:
why does vayne's w need to deal **% max hp true damage?** I see no logical reason for it.  sure she's squishy, but that is just going to far.  every damage anything should have at the very least items to build to resist it, but with her passive you can't to more than mildly slow down the nuke.  please make it flat damage instead of % max hp.

edit: correction and clarification to the above.  first off, i don't think she needs a nerf or anything, i just don't think that kind of damage is healthy.  they should A) make it a large amount of flat true damage and/or B) lower the base and give it an ad ratio

I mean, they work well, but she just powers through them with her w.  im not saying she shouldn't have true dmg at all, that's retarded.  im saying it shouldn't be % max hp

Sorry. But % HP true damage is Vayne's unique advantage, and reason she is picked over other ADC's. Without it she would be somewat bad. She has not reasonable way to harass her enemies during laning and her laning is generally pretty bad. She would be basically nothing without her tankbusting ability. During laning Vayne will almost never land silver bolts on you if you play smart, or if she does she will propabky hurt herself more in process. Yes, her lategame is amazing, but to get there she needs to work. Just like Caitlyn has strong early with cost of falling off later.
well they could at the very least reduce the base and give it a scaling.

Why does she need a nerf in your opinion? You can't just look at one spell on her kit and say she is OP. Her winrate is nothing expectional. There are a lot more OP ADC's in existance, I would say Vayne is one of the most balanced ADC's since she has clear strengths and weaknesses.

im not saying she needs a nerf, im saying its unhealthy for her to have a % max hp true damage ability that's entirely base.  you could build her straight tank with a little atk speed and still be nuking the crap out of people because her only ability with a reasonable scaling is her q.  so i guess what im trying to say is it isn't her w by itself that i don't like but it in combination with the lack of scalings and then the stealth.  I'm not saying shes super op or that she has no counterplay, i just want to be able to build defensive against her without having to dedicate half of my build to it and i would like her to actually need some decent ad for it to deal as much.

If you give it an ad scaling that is basically a nerf, you would be weakening her already weak early game in order to make her "more healthy" Also you would. E destroying one of the unique build paths amongst all adc's. She is the only adc that can go botrk into phantom dancer/shiv. I think build variety across a role is far healthier fir the game. Also the percentile max health true damage is her gimmick, take that away and there is literally no reason to play vayne over other adcs. Draven gets more ad on auto attacks, vars cam stack multiple targets, most adcs out range her and have hard cc or a better escape

im not saying they should take away the true damage (which is her gimmick, not the % hp part), im saying they should make it a high flat amount and/or lower the base and give it a scaling.  it wouldn't even necessarily be a nerf to her early game depending on how you did the numbers.  I just want to be able to itemize against it reasonably well without having to dedicate half my slots to it.  technically, it would be a nerf but lets be honest, its pretty stupid that her w is entirely base damage on top of being % max hp true damage.  that way not only is it nearly impossible to build defensive against her successfully without dedicating most of your build to it, but she can also just build pure atk speed and still be nuking people.  heck, she can build pure tank with a botrk and wits end and still be nuking people.  and lets not forget that without a scaling it makes it so that her damage doesn't go down much regardless of how behind she is in gold.  I honestly don't see why people even build her as an adc, shes at least as successful as a tank because she can still deal that enormous damage to everyone.  again, not saying they should reduce her overall damage, just make it easier to itemize against and don't let this build be god tier {{item:3046}} {{item:3046}} {{item:3153}} {{item:3006}} {{item:3026}} {{item:3031}}.

Gnar and Varus have similar % max health damage, difference being they will generally proc theirs for more damage until something like 70 mr. This means that if vayne builds pure attack speed any glass cannon build will kill her. The scaling on her silver bolts is kept low specifically to prevent it from being overbearing. And yes her identity is THE quintessential tank killing hyper carry adc. Without her w in its current design she would be probably end up being harder to balance than she currently is and they would end up buffing either her attack range or her q range

Firedancer, the reason is her weak early game.

The "flaw" (if you can call it that) in your argument is that she gets these things for free. Not so. She gets them in exchange for short range and some of the worst laning in LoL. She has to work to get her farm, and she basically hands her opponent a free lane (assuming no jungle involvement).

The entire idea behind Vayne is for her to be a heavily scaling, late game hyper carry. If she is strong before late game, it's because someone fed her. When Vayne gets fed, it's because she's a LOT better than you, or her jungle is WAY outplaying you. It's similar to Nasus, but in an ADC. I hope this helps you understand why she is that way.

TL;DR - Yes, she's supposed to do that by design, and she's also supposed to pay for it with early game weakness.

funny you should say scaling, because aside from the small ratio on her e, her q is the only ability she has with an ad scaling.  that's what i was just about to edit in my post, that they should either make it a large flat amount of true damage or lower the base a bunch and give it a scaling.

Vayne scales best with attack speed, not AD. Her lack of AD ratios has nothing to do with her weak early game; you're at least correct about that.

Her damage also isn't lacking early game, and I never said it was. The issue is her short range, which can easily be abused to win trades and keep her from cs'ing. Fighting her at an even all-in is inadvisable at all levels, in my experience.

And this is the crux of the matter; I only disagree with you because she NEEDS %health true damage to be balanced. If they buffed her early game, she wouldn't need it anymore. The only reason I disagree with you about %health true damage being unhealthy is because Vayne is the only example, and she needs it.

If they buffed her early game, okay. Then you're right. But it's conditional on that, imo.

> Fighting her at an even all-in is inadvisable at all levels, in my experience.

honestly, that right there is why I've never really considered her to have that weak of an early game if you and your support play it out right (especially if that support is Leona).  if you can just constantly all-in them and keep their support from smacking away on vayne, you actually typically win early game.

Eh... I can't imagine that a vayne would win lane without playing quite a bit better than her opponent. Yes, engage supports can help increase the threat of poking her, which helps cover her weakness, but it doesn't make her a strong laner. I just can't agree with that.
not saying shes a strong laner, im just saying if you and your support know your junk she certainly isn't weak most of the time.

That's a semnatics argument. I'm saying that isn't true. Whether you call it "weak laning" or not is irrelevant. The point I'm making is that she IS weak in the early game. You disagree, and that's fine. You are talking about minimizing risk in that weak early game, and I'm saying that only works especially well if you're already better than your opponent.

Basically, Silver Bolts works on Vayne because:

* She has no way of attacking anyone outside of her autoattack range
* She has no waveclear or poke
* Silver Bolts requires three hits to the same target before dealing damage

I would recommend looking at a Vayne's damage distribution to champions after a game at some point.  The true damage from Silver Bolts tends to be able 1/6 of her damage to champions, while she deals primarily physical damage.  Considering her short range and weak early game, this steroid is acceptable on her kit.

You can't just look at abilities in isolation to judge their strength; you have to consider the rest of the champion's kit.

ive played her to and I honestly think that it would be better if it were just a high flat amount.  im not saying that the damage itself is too high, but that the fact that its % max hp true damage makes itemizing against it near impossible if you don't want to burn half or more of your build on nothing but armor/health items.  basically, you have to custom build against her and hope that it works against the rest of the team as well.

it's actually a lot less satisfying this way though, another problem, vayne only has a range of 450...she has the lowest range of all the carries

Vayne is the Anti-tank. Vayne is easy to kill, but the point of her is that you *have* to kill her, or you die. There is no defending against her for very long. Now, {{item:3110}} {{item:3143}} {{item:3075}} help tremendously, but they are just prolonging the inevitable. But thankfully, this is why well built teams have an assassin. An assassin can run in, and kill Vayne. With Vayne gone, the tank is free to do the whole wall of meat thing, and save the assassin.
